entry.title: :page_facing_up: paper on parkinson’s and dl
entry.content: I pre-published the results of my master’s thesis on Wearable-based Parkinson’s Disease Severity Monitoring using Deep Learning. Read the paper here.

category.term: parkinsons, thesis, sensor, wearable, tsc, dl

entry.title: :mega: talk @ dadada munich 2019
entry.content:
I had the chance to talk about my Master’s thesis at the Datageeks Data Day (DADADA) 2019 in Munich. Awesome event, awesome community and awesome discussions on quantification of uncertainty in machine learning.

  • read the slides (use fullscreen mode for the optimal experience)
  • watch the talk
entry.summary: I had the chance to talk about my Master’s thesis at the Datageeks Data Day (DADADA) 2019 in Munich. Awesome event, awesome community and awesome discussions on quantification of uncertainty in machine learning.

entry.title: :hammer: cnn based sentiment analysis
entry.content:
Small project on text analysis via CNN’s within a uni seminar. Using an alphabet-based character-level dummy-encoding allows for the application of 1D Cnns for classification of yelp reviews. Based on work from Zhang, Zhao and LeCunn (2015). Also included Local Interpretable Model-Agnostic Explanations (LIME) by Marco Ribeiro to make sense out of complex decision makers such as CNNs.

  • check the repo
  • read the slides

category.term: cnn, deep learning, text, sentiment, yelp

entry.summary: Small project on text analysis via CNN’s within a uni seminar. Using an alphabet-based character-level dummy-encoding allows for the application of 1D Cnns for classification of yelp reviews. Based on work from Zhang, Zhao and LeCunn (2015). Also included Local Interpretable Model-Agnostic Explanations (LIME) by Marco Ribeiro to make sense out of complex decision makers such as CNNs.

entry.title: :hammer: road segmentation
entry.content:
Together with Niklas Klein, I was working on a road segmentation (in: satellite image, out: road map) using the infamous U-Net as part of our master’s curriculum.

  • read the slides from a talk about it at a Meetup in 2018
  • check the repo and reproduce our results with public data
entry.summary: Together with Niklas Klein, I was working on a road segmentation (in: satellite image, out: road map) using the infamous U-Net as part of our master’s curriculum.
